operation.descriptionCdata:
5082f8f7-6000-4eee-989a-82bd749504e1.15a73c62-f30f-4e11-b098-fe6b7a47f793.prompt=Username\: 5082f8f7-6000-4eee-989a-82bd749504e1.197c4333-859e-43fa-a75e-672e87755b42.prompt=Scope type\: 5082f8f7-6000-4eee-989a-82bd749504e1.28d01009-29f0-4cec-b196-c2a2f187bbbc.prompt=Password\: 5082f8f7-6000-4eee-989a-82bd749504e1.71816eab-1762-440d-8a70-aeea5cf6feb4.prompt=Use SSL? 5082f8f7-6000-4eee-989a-82bd749504e1.8be882b3-165d-479e-a22f-8397a7c81706.prompt=Host Name\: 5082f8f7-6000-4eee-989a-82bd749504e1.description=
Gets the execution policies for the current session. The execution policy is determined by execution policies that is set using Set Execution Policy and the Group Policy settings for the Windows PowerShell execution policy. The default execution policy is "Restricted" and must be changed before any PowerShell scripts can be executed.

The execution policy is part of the security strategy of Windows PowerShell. It determines whether configuration files (including Windows PowerShell profile) can be loaded, and whether scripts can be executed. It also determines which scripts, if any, must be digitally signed before they will execute.

Remoting must be enabled on the target computer to run this operation remotely. Go to http\://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/magazine/ff700227.aspx for instructions on how to enable remoting on a Windows computer.

For more on execution policies, go to http\://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd347641.aspx

Inputs\: 
host	- The host name or the IP address of the target Windows computer.
username	- Username to use for thread impersonation on the RAS host for this operation (can be left blank). The user to execute the PowerShell script as.
password	- Password of the user.
scope	- Takes the value "All","Current","LocalMachine","CurrentUser","Process","MachinePolicy","UserPolicy". The default scope "All", gets all execution policy values for the session, listed in order of precedence. The "Current" scope gets the effective execution policy. When executed in a PowerShell v1.0 context, this input is ignored and the operation returns the effective execution policy for the current session. "MachinePolicy" gets the execution policy set by a Group Policy for all users of the computer.  "UserPolicy" gets the execution policy set by a Group Policy for the current user of the computer. "Process" gets the execution policy that is set for the current Windows Powershell process. "CurrentUser" gets the execution policy that is set for the current user. "LocalMachine" gets the execution policy that is set for all users of the computer.
ssl         	- Whether SSL should be used while invoking the script remotely. This input defaults to false, and is ignored for local script execution. If SSL is not available on the port used for the operation, the operation will fail.

Responses\:
success	- The command ran successfully.
failure	- The command failed to run.

Result\:
The return code of the operation.

Extra Results\:
returnResult	- The result of the script execution.

Note\: 
1. This operation does not support Remoting on PowerShell 1.0.

2. If the target computer is not present in the list of Trusted Hosts in WS-Management of the RAS host, the operation may fail when using the target computer's system account as user credentials.
operation.name: Get Execution Policy

link.refName: Windows Powershel Scope All Current LocalMachine CurrentUser Process MachinePolicy UserPolicy details
